channel.title: Prerequisite on Recommender System Solution
channel.description: Recent content in Prerequisite on Recommender System Solution

item.title: AWS Cloud9
item.description: AWS Cloud9 is a cloud-based integrated development environment (IDE) that lets you write, run, and debug your code with just a browser. It includes a code editor, debugger, and terminal. Get started with AWS Cloud9 Go to AWS Cloud9 Console Click “Create environment” button to create an cloud9 environment Name it rs-workshop, click Next Take all default values and click Create environment When it comes up, the cloud9 console environment should looks like below:

item.title: Install eksctl
item.description: eksctl is a command line tool for working with EKS clusters that automates many individual tasks. install eksctl using the following command: curl --silent --location "https://github.com/weaveworks/eksctl/releases/latest/download/eksctl_$(uname -s)_amd64.tar.gz" | tar xz -C /tmp sudo mv -v /tmp/eksctl /usr/local/bin Confirm the eksctl command works: eksctl version

item.title: Install kubectl
item.description: kubectl is a command line tool for working with Kubernetes clusters. install kubectl using the following command: sudo curl --silent --location -o /usr/local/bin/kubectl https://amazon-eks.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1.19.6/2021-01-05/bin/linux/amd64/kubectl sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/kubectl Confirm the kubectl command works: kubectl version
